Jokowi Beri Tenggat Kapolri Ungkap Kasus Novel Baswedan Desember
01 Nov 2019, 09:35 by Friski Riana, Juli Hantoro
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi mengaku memberi tenggat waktu kepada Kepala Kepolisian RI Jenderal Idham Azis untuk menuntaskan kasus Novel Baswedan. "Saya sudah sampaikan ke Kapolri baru, saya beri waktu sampai awal Desember," kata Jokowi dalam dialog bersama wartawan Istana Kepresidenan di Istana Merdeka, Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Masa kerja tim teknis kasus Novel berakhir pada Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019. Sejumlah pihak mendesak tim teknis yang semula dipimpin Idham Azis ini mengumumkan temuan mereka kepada publik.
Tim teknis kasus Novel dibentuk pada awal Agustus lalu dengan melibatkan 120 personel kepolisian. Tim diberi waktu tiga bulan hingga akhir Oktober untuk mengungkap pelaku penyerangan terhadap Novel. Namun hingga hari ini, Polri belum mengungkap hasil temuan tim tersebut.
Sebelumnya, Polri juga telah membentuk Tim Gabungan Pencari Fakta (TGPF) kasus Novel Baswedan yang bekerja dalam kurun Januari-7 Juli 2019. Namun, tim bentukan Tito Karnavian, Kapolri saat itu, tak berhasil mengungkap pelaku dan aktor penyerangan terhadap Novel.
Kasus ini bermula saat dua orang tak dikenal menyiram air keras kepada Novel pada 11 April 2017. Saat penyidik KPK itu pulang salat subuh berjamaah di masjid dekat rumahnya di bilangan Kelapa Gading, Jakarta Utara. Serangan itu diduga terkait dengan kiprah Novel menangani perkara korupsi kakap di KPK.
Air keras itu mengenai mata Novel, menyebabkan kerusakan 95 persen di mata kiri dan membuat mata kanannya harus memakai hard lens untuk membantu penglihatan.
Adapun Novel Baswedan sebelumnya menyayangkan Presiden Jokowi yang masih menunggu hasil tim teknis Polri."Sekarang ini sudah sekian lama. Presiden mau bicara apa lagi beliau?" tuturnya.

Jokowi Gives Dead Date for Police Chief to Reveal Baswedan Novel Case in December
01 Nov 2019, 09:35 by Friski Riana, Juli Hantoro
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - President Joko Widodo or Jokowi claimed to give a deadline to the Indonesian Police Chief General Idham Azis to resolve the Baswedan Novel case. "I have conveyed it to the new National Police Chief, I will give until the beginning of December," Jokowi said in a dialogue with reporters at the Presidential Palace at the Merdeka Palace, Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019.
The work period of the Novel case technical team ended on Thursday, 31 October 2019. A number of parties urged the technical team that was originally led by Idham Azis to announce their findings to the public.
The Novel case technical team was formed in early August involving 120 police personnel. The team was given three months until the end of October to uncover the perpetrators of the attack on the Novel. But to this day, the National Police has not revealed the findings of the team.
Previously, the National Police had also formed a Joint Fact Finding Team (TGPF) for the Baswedan Novel case which worked in the period January-7 July 2019. However, the team formed by Tito Karnavian, the National Police Chief at the time, failed to reveal the perpetrators and actors who attacked the Novel.
This case began when two unidentified men poured hard water on Novel on April 11, 2017. When the KPK investigator returned at dawn prayers in congregation at a mosque near his home in Kelapa Gading, North Jakarta. The attack was allegedly related to Novel's work on the high profile corruption case at the KPK.
The hard water hit Novel's eye, causing 95 percent damage in his left eye and making his right eye have to use a hard lens to help vision.
The Baswedan novel previously regretted President Jokowi, who was still waiting for the results of the National Police technical team. "Now it's been a long time. What president do you want to talk to?" he said.
